name: Irving House at Harvard

reviews.text: I stayed at Irving House for four days while participating in a workshop at the Harvard Graduate School of Education, and was very sorry to leave! Tucked away on a leafy little side street right on the edge of the Harvard campus, this wonderful bed & breakfast is the best of both worlds--strolling distance to everything in the heart of Cambridge, yet quiet, home-like and welcoming. I stayed in a spotless room with a queen-sized bed and a private bathroom, flat-screen tv, free wi-fi--this is an older building, but has been beautifully updated and renovated without sacrificing the details that give a house some character. Breakfast is varied and plentiful--a serve-yourself assortment ranging from cereal to eggs, organic milk and yogurt to fresh pastries, cheeses, and fruits. Really excellent coffee, too. Irving House also has a varied collection of read-it-and-take-it books--another of the gently quirky but endearing qualities that make this place so special.
reviews.title: Like staying at the home of a good friend

reviews.text: I stayed at this B&B for a three-day business trip. First, let me say that my room was quite nice. I had a queen with bathroom, and the room was fairly spacious, nicely if modestly decorated, with a desk, chair and full bathroom. The bed was comfortable and good for sleeping.
reviews.title: Cute overnight stay, but it has its limitations

reviews.text: The challenge during my stay was dealing with the hallway noise. This is a busy B&B (really it's an inn), and the hallways are small and the room doors close together. I had a family staying next door that was constantly opening and closing their door and talking in the hallway. It was distracting.
reviews.title: Great place, greater people...

reviews.text: Breakfast was simple and a few steps above a typical continental breakfast. However, the breakfast did not change at all during my stay. Overall, the breakfast was not in the same ranking as the splendid B&B breakfasts I've had elsewhere. I decided on my final day to forego the continental breakfast and grab breakfast down the street.
reviews.title: Cannot say enough good things about this place.

reviews.text: Overall, this is a cute place to stay overnight on a tight budget. However, I would not recommend it for a longer term stay.
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.text: We spent 4 great days here. The staff was super friendly and helpful, the room huge and comfortable. Breakfast amazing!!! Hot drinks and sweets all afternoon. The family room fit 2 adults and 2 teens. We will be back!
reviews.title: Great bargain a stone's throw from Harvard!

reviews.text: I found Irving House through the internet one month before my travel dates and it was just as I had expected. Nice, cozy, homey and in very close proximity to Harvard University. The room on the third floor (305) was rather small but I did not feel claustrophobic at all. It had 3 nice, large windows, a desk, private bath, and even books to read (which you could even bring home, if you like). The bed was also comfy. Since I came here to visit some old friends, fellow Harvard alumni, I was only at Irving House during night time. I would have loved to just sit and relax at the nice, homey living room on the first floor, or sit on the porch while drinking tea, or read a book, or write something, as the atmosphere was so nice. Maybe I would do that the next time. I will certainly recommend Irving House to my fellow Harvard alumni abroad, if they happen to visit Cambrige.
reviews.title: Homey place close to Harvard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Irving House is a relaxing 10 minute walk to Harvard Square. The subway to Boston is right there too. The people are friendly and the rooms are very well kept.
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet, Quaint and Good Location!

reviews.text: They offer a continental breakfast of muffins, bagels, yogurt, cereal, fruit, etc.
reviews.title: Comfortable and cozy B&B

reviews.text: The beds are comfortable and rooms are a good size. The bathrooms are clean inside the rooms and in the hallways.
reviews.title: 4th floor walkup, no elevator

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is friendly and very helpful. Everything is immaculately clean. The breakfasts are extraordinary (fresh fruit, yogurts, cereals, cheeses, pastries, eggs, great tea selections, fair traded coffee). The location is quiet and easy walking distance to Harvard venues. We selected a room that did not have a bath ensuite but down the hall and it was no problem and we never had to wait. Computers are available. Free parking behind the building. AARP discount of 10%. Plus, they'll even supply postcards and postage anywhere in the world! What's not to love? Thank you, Irving House.
reviews.title: What's not to love?

reviews.text: The Irving House was recommended to me by several people when I was (somewhat desperately) looking for a high-quality, but not too expensive, place to stay in Cambridge. I was travelling to a wedding - which was scheduled the same weekend as both Harvard's and MIT's Parents' Weekends, so you can imagine what I was facing!
reviews.title: Charming, lovely place, great staff, fantastic location - and good value!

reviews.text: Not only was the place absolutely charming, quiet, and located on a quiet but central street - the staff were great, the breakfast was exactly what I wanted/needed, and the price (as compared to other local hotels) made it a great value.
reviews.title: A lovely B&B convenient to downtown Cambridge

reviews.text: I'd certainly recommend it, and if/when my travels take me back to Cambridge, there's no question where I'll stay.
reviews.title: Nice B&B next to Harvard

reviews.text: Thank you to all the staff and the owners!
reviews.title: Great place, great value, great location...

reviews.text: I stayed in The Irving House in Decermber as a few friends were staying there too. It was a good value for the location, but my room was a bit small, (a twin up against the wall) and had to share a bathroom which I am not a big fan of. But this was the only room that was available. The bigger rooms with the private baths were very nice. And the location is great with a 10-15 minute walk to Harvard Square. The breakfast was yummy and had a great variety. It reminded me of the European B&B's.
reviews.title: A cozy B&B for a great value

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again. But would prefer a room with my own bath.
reviews.title: Incredible hospitality, price, and guest services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Irving House really embodies the definition of hospitality and home-from-home. It was such a joy to stay there.
reviews.title: Good place, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highlights included:
reviews.title: Hot! Hot! Hot!

reviews.text: - I stayed here for business but during my birthday. When Rachel, the manager, found out that it was my birthday, she gave me a room discount, a gift bag with local goodies in it, and giftcards to local shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Comfortable, convenient, affordable

aka: Irving House At Harvard Hotel Cambridge
description: Irving House is a quaint bed and breakfast in Cambridge offering uniquely cozy accommodations and a variety of amenities for our guests to enjoy. Built as a two-family house in the 1890s, Irving House was converted to a bed and breakfast in the 1920s with 44 unique guest rooms in a variety of sizes. There are many room types to accommodate the ranging needs of our guests, from individual travelers to families.
